title: Mathematics Education Design for Inclusive Virtual Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of basic mathematical concepts at the middle school level
context.additional_context: Blended classroom environment using BYOD, accommodating adult learners with diverse learning paces and abilities, with preparations required for potential inclusion of students with disabilities

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more digital learning tools considering various disability types and explain how to utilize them.
Learners can develop instructional plans to teach mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, functions) with visual and auditory aids in an inclusive virtual environment.
Learners can design mathematical problem-solving activities utilizing accessibility tools (e.g., screen readers, caption generators) in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment.

resources: Free accessibility tools (OpenDyslexic font, NVDA screen reader)
Virtual laboratory software for mathematics education
Alternative material templates for offline printing

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
